net.sf.mmm.transaction.base

Class AbstractTransactionExecutor.AbstractTransactionAdapter<TRANSACTION>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.transaction.base.AbstractTransactionExecutor.AbstractTransactionAdapter<TRANSACTION>
  • Type Parameters:
    TRANSACTION - is the generic type of the underlying native transaction.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionAdapter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JpaTransactionExecutor.JpaTransactionAdapter, JtaTransactionExecutor.JtaTransactionAdapter, NoTransactionExecutor.NoTransactionAdapter, SpringTransactionExecutor.SpringTransactionAdapter
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractTransactionExecutor

    protected abstract class AbstractTransactionExecutor.AbstractTransactionAdapter<TRANSACTION>
extends Object
implements TransactionAdapter
    This is the abstract base implementation of the TransactionAdapter interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private TRANSACTION activeTransaction 
      private TransactionContext context 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractTransactionAdapter()
      The constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit()
      This method commits the current transaction without opening a new transaction.
      protected abstract TRANSACTION createNewTransaction()
      This method creates a new technical transaction.
      protected abstract void doCommit()
      This method performs the actual commit() on the active transaction.
      protected abstract void doRollback()
      This method performs the actual rollback() on the active transaction.
      protected TRANSACTION getActiveTransaction()
      This method gets the underlying native transaction that is currently active.
      TransactionContext getContext()
      This method gets the TransactionContext that allows to add individual data to be associated with this TransactionAdapter.
      void interCommit()
      This method commits the transaction currently active and opens a new one.
      boolean isActive()
      This method determines if this context holds an active transaction.
      void rollback()
      This method performs a rollback of the current transaction.
      protected void start()
      This method has to be called after construction in order to start the transaction.
      protected void stop()
      This method has to be called at the end of the transactional execution to end transaction.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • start

        protected void start()
        This method has to be called after construction in order to start the transaction.

      • stop

        protected void stop()
        This method has to be called at the end of the transactional execution to end transaction.

      • createNewTransaction

        protected abstract TRANSACTION createNewTransaction()
        This method creates a new technical transaction.
        Returns:
        the new native transaction.

      • getActiveTransaction

        protected TRANSACTION getActiveTransaction()
                                    throws TransactionNotActiveException
        This method gets the underlying native transaction that is currently active.
        Returns:
        the active transaction.
        Throws:
        TransactionNotActiveException - if there is no active transaction.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        This method determines if this context holds an active transaction.
        This is the case until TransactionAdapter.commit() or TransactionAdapter.rollback() was called explicitly.
        Specified by:
        isActive in interface TransactionAdapter
        Returns:
        true if there is an active transaction or false otherwise.

      • getContext

        public TransactionContext getContext()
        This method gets the TransactionContext that allows to add individual data to be associated with this TransactionAdapter.
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface TransactionAdapter
        Returns:
        the TransactionContext.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        This method commits the current transaction without opening a new transaction. It allows to throw an exception in your callable but end with a commit rather than a TransactionAdapter.rollback().
        ATTENTION:
        Please only use this method as end-user if there is no other way to solve your problem.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface TransactionAdapter

      • interCommit

        public void interCommit()
        This method commits the transaction currently active and opens a new one. You should use this method for (recoverable) batches that process large sets of data and therefore would overload if everything was done in one technical transaction.
        Specified by:
        interCommit in interface TransactionAdapter

      • doCommit

        protected abstract void doCommit()
        This method performs the actual commit() on the active transaction.

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        This method performs a rollback of the current transaction. It allows to return from your callable without committing and or throwing an exception.
        ATTENTION:
        Please only use this method as end-user if there is no other way to solve your problem.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface TransactionAdapter

      • doRollback

        protected abstract void doRollback()
        This method performs the actual rollback() on the active transaction.
